titlestmt.titleproper: Jaffrey, N.H. United Church of Jaffrey records, 1827-1980.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday October 5, 2020 at 18:58

did.unittitle: Jaffrey, N.H. United Church of Jaffrey records, 1827-1980.
did.abstract: The roots of the United Church of Jaffrey start in 1850 when 23 members of Jaffrey's First Congregational Church established Jaffrey East Orthodox Congregational Church, erecting a meeting-house the same year. The United Church records document the history and life of the church, including reports, meeting minutes, vital statistics, financial information, church bulletins, auxiliary groups, correspondence, and property deeds. Records are fragmentary and incomplete.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Jaffrey, N.H. United Church of Jaffrey records, 1827-1980, RG0106. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Permanently loaned to the Congregational Library & Archives by The United Church of Jaffrey, June 1991; Acc# 1992-1.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Re-processed by Zachary Bodnar, August 2017, using DACS Second Edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The roots of the United Church of Jaffrey start in 1850 when 23 members of Jaffrey's First Congregational Church established Jaffrey East Orthodox Congregational Church, erecting a meeting-house the same year. The church built a parsonage and vestry in 1876. When the town's Universalist minister, Myron L. Cutler, died in 1930 the members of his church chose to join with East's congregation rather than find a new minister. The members of East also had connections with the Baptist church and still with First Congregational. Further inter-denominational ties were drawn when Jaffrey's Baptist minister, Roger Floyd, left his position in 1949. The small Baptist church chose to close rather than find a new minister; most of the members joined East. At this point, there were equal number of Baptists and Congregationalists, prompting a shift in name and organization. East Orthodox Church became the Federated Church with separate covenants for each denomination. In 1957 the Congregational members of the church voted to become a Covenant member of the New Hampshire Conference of the New Hampshire Conference of the United Church of Christ. After maintaining membership with both Baptist and UCC denominations, the members decided to withdraw from the Baptist Convention in 1970 to simplify day to day work as well as strengthen the bond as one United Church.

The Federated Church continued services in the old Baptist building, which was larger than the Congregational building. In 1959 the Federated Church dissolved its two components and formed the United Church of Jaffrey. Further building changes started in 1967. The old parish hall and parsonage were in disrepair. The current trend by mid-20th century was for ministers to live in their own house. This, plus the cost of restoration, meant the church chose to tear down the parsonage and old hall and build a new hall in 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The United Church records document the history and life of the church, including reports, meeting minutes, vital statistics, financial information, church bulletins, auxiliary groups, correspondence, and property deeds. Please be sure to read the history of the church and note both Universalist and Baptist church records are included from those extinct congregations. All series records are fragmentary and incomplete.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection has been organized into the five series listed below. Within each series, records have been arranged chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Cutter, Daniel B. History of the town of Jaffrey New Hampshire, from the date of the Masonian Charter to the present time, 1749-1880, Concord NH: Republican Press Association. 1881. (T J18.4C)
Gerould, Samuel L. The Congregational and Presbyterian Churches and Ministers of New Hampshire Connected With the General Association. Lebanon NH : H.E. Waite & Co. 1900. (9.3.67 (2))
Lawrence, Robert F. The New Hampshire Churches: comprising histories of the Congregational and Presbyterian churches in the state. . . Claremont Manufacturing Co. 1856. (9.3.36)
Livingston, W.W. and DeBevoise, G.H. Seventy Years of Cheshire Conference. Keene NH : Darling & Co. 1897. (9.6.37(1))

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: The United Church of Jaffrey, UCC. Celebrating 150 Years 1850-2000. Jaffrey: United Church of Jaffrey, U.C.C., 2000

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The first meeting of the First Baptist Church in Jaffrey met on January 28, 1814. In 1823 the First Baptist Church & Society was formed and incorporated. After Rev. Roger Floyd departed in 1949, the Baptists voted to join in federation with the East Congregational Church, forming The Federated Church in Jeffrey. In 1959, after a decade of separate worship, the Congregationalists and Baptists joined fully and formed the United Church of Jaffrey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Baptist Female Benevolent Working Society minutes

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1850, 23 members of Jaffrey's First Congregational Church requested letters of dismission to begin a new Church in the increasingly populous eastern part of the town. That same year the East Congregational Church was built. 1876 saw an expansion of the church's property with the addition of a parsonage and vestry. In 1949, the Congregational and Baptist churches joined in Federation becoming the Federated Church of Jaffrey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes records from the East Jaffrey Congregational Church in Jaffrey, NH. Types of records include: meeting minutes for several church societies; vital statistics; treasurer's records; correspondence; news clippings; property deeds; church letters; church histories; 1 photograph.

did.unittitle: Memorial funds, bank book, and wills
Documentation and receipts for church name change

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The First Universalist Society of Jaffrey was started in 1822 and the Society was incorporated as a religious corporate body in 1875. The death of Rev. Myron L. Cutler in 1930, after serving his church for 43 years, became the impetus for the small congregation to close permanently with many of its members joining East Congregational Church and smaller numbers joining both the Baptist Church and First Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Federated Church of Jaffrey formed in 1949 after the First Baptist Church and the East Jaffrey Congregational Church joined in federation. The two denominations maintained separate worship and Covenants with the New Hampshire Baptist Convention and New Hampshire Conference of Congregational-Christian Churches. Worship was held at the Federated Church while the Baptist Church at Charity Square became the new Parish Hall and center of church-related activities. In 1959, at the recommendation of the Rev. Richard Stoughton, Jr., the two member churches of the Federated Church dissolved and together formed the United Church of Jaffrey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes records from the Federated Church in Jaffrey, NH. Types of records include: meeting minutes for several church societies; annual meeting minutes; church correspondence; Sunday calendars; religious histories; sermon.

did.unittitle: Articles of agreement, amendments, and incorporation

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The United Church of Jaffrey formed out of the Federated Church in 1959, when the East Congregational Church and First Baptist Church dissolved to form into a single church body. The United Church of Jaffrey is a member of the United Church of Christ and continues to serve its community today.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Proposals to unite, constitution, and by-laws
Building alterations, programs and news clippings
